section.p: How do I print a photo?

Photos can be accessed through the app’s Photos window. To access existing photos, tap the Albums icon. If your mobile device includes a built-in camera, you can take a new photo to print by tapping the Camera icon. Once you’ve selected a photo, you can adjust print options.
How do I print a document?
Documents can be accessed through the app’s Documents window. To access existing documents, tap the Documents icon. Once you’ve selected a document, you can adjust print options.
What types of files can I print?

You can print .JPG, .PNG, .PDF, .TIFF, and .XPS files. On iOS devices, you can also print .HTML, .RTF, and .TXT files, as well as all Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) or iWork (Keynote, Numbers, and Pages) file types. On Android devices, .TXT and .HTML files print at lower resolution.
What printing options are available through the app?

The print quality options supported in the app are High, Normal, and Draft. Paper size options are Letter, Legal, Ledger, Statement, A3, A4, A5, A6, Folio, B4, B5, and B6. You can also select the number of copies to print, number of pages per sheet, and page range. Additional options include color or B&W printing, duplex (2-sided) printing, stapling, or hole-punching. While the app supports a wide range of printing options, it cannot detect which options are available on a specific printing device or MFP. To ascertain which options are available on your printing device, consult the device’s operation guide.
Can I select the paper tray?

No. Print jobs are automatically sent to the printing device’s default paper tray. However, if the paper size that you selected is in a tray other than the default, that tray will be used to print the job.
Can I save a new photo taken in KYOCERA Mobile Print?

Yes. On iOS devices, new photos taken in the app are saved to the device’s native Albums folder. On Android devices, new photos are saved in your specified download folder or in the default /sdcard/Download folder.
How do I view stored photos or documents in KYOCERA Mobile Print?

On iOS devices, you can access stored photos or documents in the Documents window. On Android devices, you can access stored photos or documents in your specified download folder or in the default /sdcard/Download folder.
Where do I save a new scan?
On iOS devices, new scans are saved in the app’s Documents window. On Android devices, new scans are saved in your specified download folder or in the default /sdcard/Download folder.
What file formats are supported for scanning?
You can scan documents for output in .JPG, .TIFF, and .PDF formats.
Can I e-mail scanned files?

You can use your mobile device’s e-mail app to send scanned files that you have saved on your mobile device. On iOS devices, you can attach saved scans to an e-mail message and send via the device’s native Mail app. On Android devices, you can attach saved scans to an e-mail message using any e-mail app that you have installed on your device.
Is OCR supported?
No.
What is Job accounting?

Job accounting lets the system administrator keep track of all print and scan jobs initiated by users. This feature is available on compatible printers and MFPs. To enable Job accounting, contact your system administrator.
What printing protocols are supported?

RAW (port 9100), IPP (port 631), and IPPS (SSL port 443) are supported. On iOS devices, you can designate a printing protocol by tapping Settings > KYOCERA Print > Printing protocol. On Android devices, within the app, tap Menu > Advanced Settings > Printing protocol. The printing protocol selected on your mobile device must match that used by the printing device. If you are not sure which protocol is used by your printing device, contact your system administrator.
Is there a limit to the number of pages that can be scanned via the app on Android devices?
On compatible Android devices with at least 512MB of RAM, the app can scan up to 60 pages at A4/color/200 dpi or 15 pages at A3/color/600 dpi.
Can the app print PDF documents containing multiple pages with differing paper sizes?

With iOS devices, yes. With Android devices, not in one pass. In the latter case, the app can only accurately print one particular page size per print job. If your PDF document contains pages having different sizes, consider grouping pages by size and sending each group as a separate print job.
